parties.raw_snippet: THIS MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is made and effective as of the date of the Closing (as defined in the Merger Agreement (as defined below)) (the "Effective Date"), between NATIONAL FOOTBALL MUSEUM, INC., an Ohio non-profit corporation, doing business as Pro Football Hall of Fame ("PFHOF"), HOF Village Media Group, LLC (the "Village Media Company"), a Delaware limited liability company that is a wholly-owned subsidiary of HOF Village, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("HOFV") and, solely for purposes of Section 4.5, HOFV
parties.reasoning: The parties are identified in the opening paragraph of the agreement, which lists the three entities entering into the contract (with HOFV having limited involvement for Section 4.5 only).

contract_type.raw_snippet: PFHOF hereby grants to the Village Media Company a worldwide, non-exclusive, limited, non-sublicenseable and non-assignable (except to the extent set forth in this Agreement) right and license to (a) Exploit the PFHOF Works and (b) edit, supplement or otherwise adapt, incorporate or otherwise utilize, the PFHOF Works to create, produce and Exploit new, original work(s)
contract_type.reasoning: Despite the title being 'Media License Agreement', examining the core substance reveals this is fundamentally a license agreement where PFHOF grants the Village Media Company rights to exploit PFHOF Works. The primary obligation is the licensing of intellectual property rights (PFHOF Works) in exchange for annual guarantees and license fees. The agreement grants specific exploitation rights, includes approval mechanisms, and establishes payment terms typical of IP licensing arrangements.

notice_period.raw_snippet: Thereafter, the agreement shall automatically renew for successive five (5)-year terms, unless either Party gives written notice to the other Party of intent not to renew at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of the then-current Term.
notice_period.reasoning: This clause specifies the advance notice required to prevent automatic renewal of the agreement. A party must provide written notice at least 6 months before the end of the current term to prevent the automatic 5-year renewal.

expiration_date.raw_snippet: Unless otherwise terminated as provided herein, the term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall terminate on December 31, 2034
expiration_date.reasoning: The agreement specifies an explicit calendar date for the initial term expiration - December 31, 2034. This is a fixed date stated in the contract, not a relative term.

renewal_term.raw_snippet: Thereafter, the agreement shall automatically renew for successive five (5)-year terms, unless either Party gives written notice to the other Party of intent not to renew at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of the then-current Term.
renewal_term.reasoning: After the initial term ending December 31, 2034, the agreement automatically renews for successive 5-year periods unless either party provides 6 months advance notice not to renew.
